summary.part1: Hi! I'm Avital, a passionate developer focused on creating engaging web experiences. Welcome to my personal website, where you can explore my projects and learn more about me.
summary.part2: Feel free to navigate around, and don't forget to try out the game mode for a fun twist on the usual browsing experience!
summary.part3: A bit about me: I'm currently in my fifth co-op term at the University of Waterloo, studying Systems Design Engineering. I'm passionate about working with and improving User Interfaces, learning new technologies, and developing Reusable Code Architecture.
experience: 4+ years with ReactJS, Next.js, and Node.js
4+ years with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Highly familiar with RESTful APIs, TailwindCSS, Git, Agile workflows
Comfortable with Figma, Photoshop, and UI/UX design principles
Actively expanding backend & machine learning experience

aboutSection.title: About Me
aboutSection.subtitle: I enjoy building thoughtful, interactive web experiences with a strong focus on frontend development. Currently in my fifth co-op term and graduating soon, I’ve spent the last few years working with React, TypeScript, and modern web tools.

card1.title: User-Centered Engineering
card1.content: I like building interfaces that feel clear, responsive, and easy to use. My goal is always to turn real user needs into clean, scalable UI that works well across devices.

prioritiesDetail.title: How I Approach UI
list: Building reusable, maintainable components that grow with the product
Keeping accessibility, usability, and visual clarity in mind from the start
Designing mobile-first layouts that adapt naturally to larger screens
Thinking about performance early instead of treating it as a last step

card2.title: Learning by Building
card2.content: I approach frontend work with a full-stack mindset. Having experience with backend systems and APIs helps me build frontend features that are more reliable, efficient, and easier to maintain.

prioritiesDetail.title: What I Bring to the Table
list: Hands-on experience with React, Next.js, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript
Backend exposure using Node.js, Python, C++, and RESTful APIs
Comfort working with state management, data fetching, and component architecture
A strong habit of using version control, writing clear documentation, and testing my work

card3.title: Product-Minded Collaboration
card3.content: I don’t just focus on writing code—I like understanding the bigger picture. Working closely with designers and other developers helps me ship features that make sense for both users and the product.

prioritiesDetail.title: How I Work
list: Turning designs and product ideas into polished, production-ready UI
Talking through technical decisions and trade-offs with the team
Writing clean, readable code that’s easy to pick up and iterate on
Learning from feedback and continuously improving both the code and the user experience
